DataElement.preferredName: Gene Versioned Genbank Accession Number Genomic Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule)._control number:A Genbank accession number with an explicit version.:One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome._A nucleotide sequence identification number that represents a single, specific sequence in the GenBank database. [Explanatory comment: This identification number uses the accession.version format implemented by GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ in February 1999. (The unique identifier for a sequence record. An accession number applies to the complete record and is usually a combination of a letter(s) and numbers, such as a single letter followed by five digits (e.g., U12345) or two letters followed by six digits (e.g., AF123456). Some accessions might be longer, depending on the type of sequence record.) If there is any change to the sequence data (even a single base), the version number will be increased, e.g., U12345.1 â†’ U12345.2, but the accession portion will remain stable. The accession.version system of sequence identifiers runs parallel to the GI number system, i.e., when any change is made to a sequence, it receives a new GI number AND an increase to its version number. Whenever an individual searches an NCBI sequence database, only the most recent version of a record is retrieved.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

Concepts.definition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position on a particular chromosome and serves as the template for a product that contributes to a phenotype or a biological function.

Property.preferredName: Accession Number Versioned Genbank Accession Number Genomic Identifier
Property.preferredDefinition: control number:A Genbank accession number with an explicit version.:One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome.

Concepts.definition: A control number unique to an object.  It is used to identify the object among other objects in a collection.
A Genbank accession number with an explicit version.

One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredName: Versioned Genbank Accession Number Genomic Identifier
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A nucleotide sequence identification number that represents a single, specific sequence in the GenBank database. [Explanatory comment: This identification number uses the accession.version format implemented by GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ in February 1999. (The unique identifier for a sequence record. An accession number applies to the complete record and is usually a combination of a letter(s) and numbers, such as a single letter followed by five digits (e.g., U12345) or two letters followed by six digits (e.g., AF123456). Some accessions might be longer, depending on the type of sequence record.) If there is any change to the sequence data (even a single base), the version number will be increased, e.g., U12345.1 &8594; U12345.2, but the accession portion will remain stable. The accession.version system of sequence identifiers runs parallel to the GI number system, i.e., when any change is made to a sequence, it receives a new GI number AND an increase to its version number. Whenever an individual searches an NCBI sequence database, only the most recent version of a record is retrieved.]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
